dialTimeout.title: Dial Timeout
dialTimeout.description: Defines the timeout when dialing the backend TCP service. If zero, no timeout exists. (default: 30s)

dialKeepAlive.title: Dial Keep Alive
dialKeepAlive.description: Defines the interval between keep-alive probes for an active network connection. (default: 15s)

terminationDelay.title: Termination Delay
terminationDelay.description: Sets time limit for proxy to fully terminate connections after initiating termination sequence. Negative value means no deadline. (default: 100ms)

proxyProtocol.title: Proxy Protocol

version.title: Version
version.description: PROXY protocol version to use (1 or 2). Traefik supports PROXY Protocol versions 1 and 2 on TCP services.

proxyProtocol.description: Proxy Protocol configuration. An empty section enables version 2 by default.

tls.title: TLS

serverName.title: Server Name
serverName.description: Server name used for SNI (Server Name Indication) configuration

certificates.title: Certificates
certificates.description: File paths or data bytes for client mTLS certificates

insecureSkipVerify.title: Insecure Skip Verify
insecureSkipVerify.description: Controls server certificate chain and hostname verification. When true, accepts any certificate presented by the server.

rootCAs.title: Root CAs
rootCAs.description: Root certificate authorities for server certificate verification in mTLS scenarios

peerCertURI.title: Peer Certificate URI
peerCertURI.description: URI matched against SAN URIs during server certificate verification

tls.description: TLS configuration for connections to backend servers. An empty section enables TLS with default settings.

spiffe.title: SPIFFE

ids.title: IDs
ids.description: List of allowed SPIFFE IDs. Takes precedence over trust domain when specified.

trustDomain.title: Trust Domain
trustDomain.description: Allowed SPIFFE trust domain for server identity verification

spiffe.description: SPIFFE configuration for service identity verification. An empty section enables SPIFFE and allows any ID. SPIFFE requires prior enablement in install configuration before use.
